body.name: HATMINI ARGB and PWM Hub，8 Way 5V 3 Pin ARGB HUB and 8 Way 4 PIN Cooling Fan PWM Hub with Acrylic Shell and 3M Adhesive,Used to Expand The Motherboard Fan and ARGB Interface
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Main functions of ARGB PWM 2-in-1 8 way hub: expand 8-way 4-pin fan and 5v3-pin ARGB interface to solve the problem of motherboard fans Solve the problem of insufficient number of interfaces and focus on solving the problem of messy fan cables
8 Ports for Addressable RGB Lighting, if the motherboard has RGB synchronization function, lighting synchronization can be achieved

8-Channel PC Fan PWM HUB, provides a better power solution for motherboard cooling fans and CPU fans inside PC computer cases. It will effectively save your space, make cable management easier, and make the inner case tidy
The back of the ARGB + PWM Hub PCB board has 3M adhesive for easy sticking on a flat place, and the transparent acrylic cover can block most dust

Note: Only when the motherboard supports ARGB can the light be turned on. The red interface on the hub needs to be connected to a temperature-controlled fan. Other interfaces can be connected at will. However, when other interfaces are connected to three-pin fans, the speed will not be synchronized and will run at full speed.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.6 3.6 out of 5 stars 7 ratings 3.6 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 8-Way Chassis Fan Hub + 3Pin ARGB HUB HATMINI PC Case Fan Hub + 5V 3Pin ARGB HUB The motherboard ARGB (3PIN) lighting control interface and fan connector can be expanded to 8, centrally control multiple RGB lighting devices and connect 3pin/4pin fans
ARGB/PWM hub With acrylic transparent plate, 3M adhesive Effectively saves your space, makes cable management easier, and keeps the inner box tidy

8 Way Sync CPU Cooling Fan Addressable RGB Lighting PCB Splitter Note: Only when the motherboard supports ARGB can the light be turned on. The red interface on the hub needs to be connected to a temperature-controlled fan. Other interfaces can be connected at will. However, when other interfaces are connected to three-pin fans, the speed will not be synchronized and will run at full speed. The SATA port is an auxiliary power port. When too many fans are connected, the power may be insufficient and the fans cannot operate at full speed. In this case, you can solve this problem by connecting this SATA port. Generally, this SATA port does not need to be connected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gotta love ROG!
reviews.reviewText: Finally a ARGB and can hug that just works! It also finally allows me to view each ARGB device individually in SignalRGB. It works! And it looks great too in my pc. Especially as I'm going for a all ROG Strix system so a ROG hub is a must. Great build quality, bleeding edge specs as always. I'm a fan.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only a few complaints about design choices, but performance wise it's perfect.
reviews.reviewText: I like the performance of this hub, it's obvious where everything goes, and the layout is good for staying organized. That being said, it is so close to being the correct size to mount in a 2.5" or 3.5" drive slot that I really don't understand why they couldn't make that an option. The included adhesive strip is pretty large and looks strong, but it came already stuck to the bottom, even though the bottom still had the protective film on it.Ultimately when I go to permanently install this I will probably take it out of the acrylic and 3D print a mounting bracket for it instead.
Description says "up to 8 groups of addressable RGB"Upon receipt, I see there is no controller on this board.All the ARGB fan LEDs connected to this hub operate the same as each other, 1 group.

reviews.reviewTitle: Another gadget I didn't know existed until I really needed one.
reviews.reviewText: Reviewing: HATMINI ARGB and PWM Hub，8 Way 5V 3 Pin ARGB HUB and 8 Way 4 PIN Cooling Fan PWM Hub with Acrylic Shell and 3M Adhesive,Used to Expand The Motherboard Fan and ARGB Interface -- Price about $22.I am intrigued why the board is labeled Republic of Gamers, it's not advertised as being made by them. But anyway, it's well made.This comes with an assortment of cables and the box itself has a big sticky pad on the back so you can mount it in the case.There are 8 addressable Fan and light ports - And I wish it had come with a manual, but there's a lot of information in the Amazon listing so it's worth saving a copy of that.A great price, hopefully it will stay working!

The PWM Hub comes with the hub and two cables, with no printed-out paper instructions.I know it is kind of self-explanatory but checking out the product page does help a lot.A great hub to add some ARGB fans. Works for controlling a group of fans,
